bioghist.p: USS Olympia (C-6/CA-15/CL-15/IX-40) was a protected cruiser in the United States Navy during the Spanish-American War. She is most notable for being the flagship of Commodore George Dewey at the Battle of Manila Bay. The cruiser continued in service throughout World War I and was decommissioned in 1922. As of 2008, Olympia is a museum ship at the Independence Seaport Museum in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Jay S. Rogers served as a junior officer aboard the Olympia for six months in 1918 when she was escorting a convoy to Murmansk.

scopecontent.p: Journal kept by Ensign Jay S. Rogers during his service aboard USS Olympia, April 28, 1918 to October 30, 1918. In the rear of the journal there is a hand drawn map of the movements of Olympia and several poems. Photo postcards illustrate many of the places and things described in the journal, and include photos of Olympia sailing in heavy weather, images of Olympia's crew members, images of USS San Diego, the British cruiser Cornwall, and other vessels, and images of Murmansk. The collection also includes a photograph of Rogers aboard USS Olympia in 1983 and a transcription of the journal.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
